results.title: Federation Square time lapse project
results.brief_description: Time lapse footage of the construction of the Federation Square site. Includes hourly photos take from the architect’s office, commencing April 1998. Intended to be used for a short animation sequence.

results.title: Federation films: Australian films from early 20th century
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia and Chris Long
results.brief_description: This is not only a documentary of moving image history in Australia prior to and on Federation, but also a tribute to the early pioneers of the motion picture industry. Discusses the role of the Salvation Army as the largest film making body during the earlier part of this century and provides short histories of our early cameras and their operators. Highlights include The Federation Parade, scenes from the Boer War and documentaries representing Australia as part of a “Greater Britain”. These early film pieces are superbly restored.

results.title: Federation
results.creator_credit: Anna Grieve, Film Australia and Ian Munro
results.brief_description: The story of Federation is an epic tale of Australia. This three part journey to nationhood looks at the land, the people, and the nation, recounting stories of the founding fathers and of the people from six separate colonies during the decades preceding Federation. The story depicts a struggle to create an Australian democracy which occurred as a result of the federation of Australian colonies in 1901. It does not glorify events or characters or avoid the more sensitive or troublesome facts of our past. It faces the hard issues of who was excluded from the rights and privileges of Australian citizenship, and thus includes the voices of women and Indigenous people who were largely ignored at the time. The tale is one of victory and loss, success, resistance and debate, and of the struggle not just to make an Australian nation, but to create a democracy. Written by Sue Castrique and narrated by John Doyle (Roy Slaven). The story is presented in 3 episodes: The Land, The People, The Nation, although each episode can stand alone.

results.title: Federal highway
results.creator_credit: Richard Costain Film Unit, British Road Federation and Michael Healy
results.brief_description: A tour of West Germany to inspect the rapidly developing trunk road and urban motorway system. Through the Rhineland from Frankfurt to Cologne, then to Hamburg and Berlin, we see some of the road and bridge works. Aerial views of complex autobahn junctions and intersections which cannot be appreciated from the ground.

results.title: Feathers and Fools
results.brief_description: Based on a short story by Mem Fox. This is a parable about two groups of birds - swans and peacocks - who are greatly afraid of their respective differences.

results.title: Feast of St. Isidore and The Horrors of war (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Sergio Amidei, Colonna Film and Luciano Emmer
results.brief_description: This film is more that a record of Goya’s work; it is also an interpretation of the philosophy of the man himself. Two sharply differing aspects are depicted: in “The Feast of St Isidore” Goya sketched the festivities in Madrid, the excitement of the bullfight and the mixed adoration and fear in the faces of the people at the evening procession of the Virgin; in “The Horrors of War” Goya depicted all the cruelty, fear and violence of the Napoleonic invasion and the grief and pain which followe it. The film concludes with a vision of drawings showing the sadness and futility of human existence.

results.title: Fear woman
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television and Elspeth MacDougall
results.brief_description: A documentary about the status of women in Ghana, noting their reputation for independence. Points out that the women run a large part of the retail trade of the country, and that they are beginning to enter into areas which have power and influence.
